message: The validation technical components are present.
A FedRAMP SSP must define its sensitivity level.
A FedRAMP SSP must have an allowed sensitivity level.
A component must have a description with content.
A FedRAMP SSP must implement the most important controls.
A FedRAMP SSP must implement all required controls.

A FedRAMP SSP must not include implemented controls beyond what is required for the applied
                baseline.
This PE Control has a leveraged authorization - .
Implementation status is correct.
Implemented Requirement  exists.
Implemented Requirement  exists and has acceptable keywords.
Response statements have one or more components.
Response statement has a description not within a component.
Response statement does not have remarks not within a component.

Response statement
                cites a component in the system implementation inventory.
Response statement has a component which has a required description.
Response statement component description has adequate length.
Response statement component remarks have adequate length.
A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous roles.
A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous parties.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation has a unique identifier.
Every declared embedded attachment has a filename attribute.
Every declared embedded attachment has a media type.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation must have a unique identifier.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation should have a title.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation must have a rlink element.

Every supporting artifact found in a citation should be
                referenced from within the document.
A supporting artifact found in a citation should have an allowed attachment type.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation rlink must have a reference.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation rlink must have a reachable reference.
A media-type attribute must have an allowed value.
A supporting artifact found in a citation should have an embedded attachment element.
A supporting artifact found in a citation must have only one embedded attachment element.
Every embedded attachment element must have a filename attribute.
Every embedded attachment element must have a media type.

Every
                embedded attachment element must have content.

A FedRAMP
                SSP must have the FedRAMP Logo attached.

A FedRAMP SSP
                must have a User Guide attached.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must have Rules of Behavior.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a Contingency Plan attached.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a Configuration Management Plan attached.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must have an Incident Response Plan attached.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a Separation of Duties Matrix attached.

A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a policy
                document for each NIST SP 800-53 control family.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a policy document for each NIST SP 800-53 control family.

A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a
                procedure document for each NIST SP 800-53 control family.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a procedure document for each NIST SP 800-53 control family.
Policy and procedure documents must have unique per-control-family associations.
A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate one or more FIPS 140 validated modules.
Every FIPS 140 validation citation must have a validation reference.
Every FIPS 140 validation citation must have validation details.

A validation reference must provide a NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP)
                certificate number.

A validation reference must
                be in accord with its sibling validation details.
Validation details must refer to a NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate detail page.
The NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate detail page is available.

A validation details link
                must be in accord with its sibling validation reference.
An OSCAL SSP document must specify a FIPS 199 categorization.
An OSCAL SSP document must specify a security impact level.
A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed security sensitivity level.

-- A FedRAMP SSP security sensitivity level must match the highest level within the security
                impact levels.
An OSCAL SSP must specify a confidentiality security objective.
An OSCAL SSP must specify an integrity security objective.
An OSCAL SSP must specify an availability security objective.
A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed security objective value.

An SSP security objective value must be the same as highest available value of the same information type
                impact element.
An OSCAL SSP must define at least one information type.
An OSCAL SSP information type must have a title.
An OSCAL SSP information type must have a description.
A FedRAMP SSP information type must have at least one categorization.
An OSCAL SSP information type must have a confidentiality impact.
An OSCAL SSP information type must have an integrity impact.
An OSCAL SSP information type must have an availability impact.
A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have a system attribute.

A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have a correct
                system attribute.

A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have at least one information type
                identifier.

A FedRAMP SSP information type identifier must be chosen from those found in NIST SP
                800-60v2r1.

An OSCAL SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact must specify the base
                impact.

A FedRAMP SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact must specify the selected
                impact.

When SP 800-60 base and selected impacts levels differ for a given information type, the SSP must
                include a justification for the difference.

A FedRAMP SSP must indicate for its information system the appropriate categorization for the respective
                confidentiality, integrity, impact levels of its information types (per FIPS-199).

A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital Identity Determination identity assurance
                level property.

A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital Identity Determination authenticator
                assurance level property.

A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital Identity Determination federation assurance
                level property.

A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital Identity Determination identity assurance
                level.

A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital Identity Determination authenticator
                assurance level.

A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital Identity Determination federation assurance
                level.
A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate inventory items.
Every asset identifier must be unique.
An asset type should have an allowed value.
A virtual property must have an allowed value.
A public property must have an allowed value.
An allows-authenticated-scan property has an allowed value.
is-scanned property must have an allowed value.
A scan-type property must have an allowed value.
A component must have an allowed type.
A component must have an asset type.
A component must have only one asset type.
An inventory item has a unique identifier.
An inventory item must have an asset identifier.
An inventory item must have only one asset identifier.
An inventory item must have an asset-type.
An inventory item must have only one asset-type.
An inventory item must have a virtual property.
An inventory item must have only one virtual property.
An inventory item must have a public property.
An inventory item must have only one public property.
An inventory item must have a scan-type property.
An inventory item has only one scan-type property.

"infrastructure" inventory item has
                allows-authenticated-scan.

An inventory item has
                one-allows-authenticated-scan property.

"infrastructure" inventory item has
                baseline-configuration-name.

"infrastructure" inventory item has only
                one baseline-configuration-name.

"infrastructure"
                inventory item has a vendor-name property.
"infrastructure" inventory item must have only one vendor-name property.

The inventory item does not cite a banned
                vendor.
"infrastructure" inventory item must have a hardware-model property.
"infrastructure" inventory item must have only one hardware-model property.

"infrastructure" inventory item must have is-scanned
                property.

"infrastructure" inventory item must have only one
                is-scanned property.

"software or database" inventory item must have a
                software-name property.

"software or database" inventory item must have
                a software-name property.

"software or database" inventory item must have a
                software-version property.

"software or database" inventory item must
                have one software-version property.

"software or database" inventory item must have a function
                property.

"software or database" inventory item must have one
                function property.

If any inventory-item has a prop with a name of 'ipv4-address' it must also have a prop with a name
                of 'ipv6-address'.
must have an appropriate IPv4 value.
must have an appropriate IPv4 value.
must have an appropriate IPv6 value.
must have an appropriate IPv6 value.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must specify the number of current internal users.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must specify the number of current external users.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must specify the number of future internal users.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must specify the number of future external users.

A FedRAMP SSP must have a self-referential (i.e., to the SSP itself)
                component.
Email is either absent or sufficiently specified.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a FedRAMP system identifier.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a system name.
A FedRAMP SSP must have a short system name.

A FedRAMP SSP must have a description at least 32 words in
                length.

A FedRAMP
                SSP must have an allowed FedRAMP authorization type.
A FedRAMP SSP must have an active FedRAMP system identifier.
A FedRAMP leveraged authorization must have an identifier.
The FedRAMP leveraged authorization must reference a known Cloud Service Provider Package.
The System Owner role must be defined.
The Authorizing Official role must be defined.
The System Management PoC role must be defined.
The System Technical PoC role must be defined.
The System Other PoC role must be defined.

The Information System Security Officer role must be
                defined.
The Authorizing Official PoC role must be defined.
A role must have a title.

One or more responsible parties must be defined for each
                role.
The role for a responsible party must exist.
One or more parties must be identified for a responsibility.
Every responsible party must be defined.
For some roles responsible parties must be persons.
Each person should have a responsibility.

Each person should have no more than one
                responsibility.

There must be at least two (2) data centers
                listed.

There is a single primary data
                center.

There is one or more alternate data
                center(s).
Each data center address must contain a country.
Each data center must have an address that is within the United States.

Each implemented control must have one or more responsible-role
                definitions.
Each responsible-role must reference a role definition.

Each responsible-role must be referenced in a system-implementation user
                assembly.
Every user has a role identifier.
Every user has a user type.
Every user has a privilege-level.
Every user has a sensitivity level.
Every user has one or more authorized privileges.
Each identified role must reference a role definition.
User type property has an allowed value.
User privilege level has an allowed value.
User sensitivity level has an allowed value.
In an OSCAL SSP document every authorized privilege has a title.
In an OSCAL SSP document every authorized privilege has one or more functions performed.
Every authorized privilege title is not empty.
Every authorized privilege function performed has a definition.
An OSCAL SSP document includes an authorization boundary.
An OSCAL SSP document has an authorization boundary description.
A FedRAMP SSP has at least one authorization boundary diagram.
Each OSCAL SSP authorization boundary diagram has a unique identifier.
An OSCAL SSP document authorization boundary diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link rel attribute.

Each FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link rel attribute with the value
                "diagram".

A FedRAMP SSP authorization boundary diagram link
                references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
A FedRAMP SSP includes a network architecture diagram.
A FedRAMP SSP has a network architecture description.
A FedRAMP SSP has at least one network architecture diagram.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a unique identifier.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a link rel attribute.
Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a link rel attribute with the value "diagram".

A FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram link
                references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
A FedRAMP SSP includes a data flow diagram.
An OSCAL SSP document with a data flow has a description.
A FedRAMP SSP has at least one data flow diagram.
An OSCAL SSP document with a data flow diagram has a unique identifier.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a link rel attribute.
Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a link rel attribute with the value "diagram".

A FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram link references a
                back-matter resource representing the diagram document.

An OSCAL SSP document declares a related OSCAL Profile using an import-profile
                element.
The import-profile element has a reference.
The import-profile element references an available document.

The import-profile element references an available OSCAL resolved baseline profile catalog
                document.

Every implemented requirement
                has an implementation-status property.
Planned control implementations have a planned completion date.

Every implemented requirement has a
                control origin.

Every
                implemented requirement has an allowed control origination.

Every implemented requirement with a control origination of "inherited" references a leveraged
                authorization.
A partially implemented control must have a plan for complete implementation.

An
                implemented control's implementation status must be implemented, partial and planned, planned, alternative, or not
                applicable.

An implemented control must include required response point
                statements.

In the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog, all
                param elements, that do not have child value elements, have an @id value that also occurs in the matching implemented-requirement
                set-parameter element @id in the SSP.

In the SSP, all
                implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id values also occur in the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog param
                elements, that do not have child value elements, @id attributes.
Implemented Requirement  exists.
An implemented control's implementation status has an allowed value.
Incomplete control implementations have an explanation.
Planned completion date is valid.

Planned completion date
                is not past.

An inherited control implementation description must contain at least 32
                words.
A FedRAMP SSP must use correct parameter value.
A FedRAMP SSP must define a cloud service model.

A FedRAMP SSP must define an allowed cloud service
                model.

A
                FedRAMP SSP must define a leveraged authorization for any 'paas' or 'saas' cloud service model.
A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of "other" must supply remarks.
A FedRAMP SSP must define a cloud deployment model.

A FedRAMP SSP must define an allowed cloud
                deployment model.
A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud deployment model of "hybrid-cloud" must supply remarks.

When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be
                employed.

A system interconnection must have an allowed
                interconnection-direction.

A system interconnection must have an allowed interconnection-security
                value.

A system interconnection with an interconnection-security of "other" must
                have explanatory remarks.
A system interconnection must provide a remote system name.
A system interconnection must provide a remote system description.

A system interconnection must identify the direction of data
                flows.

A system interconnection must describe the
                information being transferred.
A system interconnection must describe the protocols used for information transfer.

A system interconnection must describe the
                service processor.
A system interconnection must define local and remote network addresses.

A system interconnection must define
                how the connection is secured.

A system interconnection which uses a dedicated
                circuit switching network must specify the circuit number.

A system interconnection must specify a responsible local (CSP) point of
                contact.

A system interconnection must specify a responsible remote point of
                contact.

A system interconnection must specify a local authorizing
                official.

A system interconnection must specify a remote
                authorizing official.

Every responsible person for a system
                interconnect is defined.

A system interconnection must define local responsible parties which are not remote responsible
                parties.

A system
                interconnection must define remote responsible parties which are not local responsible parties.
A system interconnection must cite an interconnection agreement.

A system interconnection must cite an intra-document defined
                interconnection agreement.

A system interconnection must cite
                an intra-document attached interconnection agreement and that agreement must be present in the SSP.
A system interconnection protocol must have a name.
A system interconnection protocol should have one or more port range declarations.
A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a transport protocol.
A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a starting port number.

A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state an ending port number. The start and end port number
                can be the same if there is one port number.

All expected network protocols are
                specified.
A DNS authoritative service is defined.

The DNS authoritative service has one or more zones
                specified.
Each zone name for the DNS authoritative service is well-formed.
Each zone for the DNS authoritative service can be resolved.
Each zone for the DNS authoritative service has DNSSEC.
